info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 8:44PM MDT until June 25 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, southwestern Adams, northern Denver, and northeastern Jefferson.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 841 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain had moved out of the area. Considerable street flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. I-70 near Pecos Street had several lanes impassable due to high water. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in a 30 minute period.
- Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Denver, western Aurora, northeastern Lakewood, southern Thornton, southeastern Arvada, southeastern Westminster, Commerce City, Northglenn, Brighton, Wheat Ridge, northern Golden, Federal Heights, southwestern Denver International Airport, Edgewater and Mountain View.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets, underpasses, drainage areas and other low lying spots.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Adams, CO; Denver, CO; Jefferson, CO
